name: formally unramified
description: A morphism $f : X \to Y$ of schemes is formally unramified if for every ring $A$, ideal $I \subset A$ with $I^2 = 0$, and commutative diagram \[ \begin{CD} \Spec A/I @>>> X \\ @VVV @VVfV \\ \Spec A @>>> Y \end{CD} \] there exists at most one morphism $\Spec A \to X$ making the diagram commute.
